transliteration: fīna nrūɧ nēkul b-šī makēn tēni.
arabic: فينا نْروح ناكُل بْشي مكان تاني.

transliteration: xallīna níbʔa níšrab ʔáhwi šī márra.
arabic: خلّينا نِبْقى نِشْرب قهْوِة شي مرّة.

english: I usually go to work by car, but I sometimes walk.
transliteration: bi-l3ādi brūɧ 3a-ššíɣil b-issayyāra bass fī awʔāt brūɧ máši.
arabic: بِالعادِة بْروح عالشِّغِل بِالسّيّارة بسّ في أَوْقات بْروح مشي.

english: I often see him at the café.

transliteration: kīf mā bá3rif [lit. I don't know how]

english: The cat somehow got in the house.
arabic: الِبْسيْنِة فاتِت عالبيْت، كيف ما بعْرِف.

english: It’s hot today. Let’s stay inside.
I like cats, but I don’t like dogs so much.
transliteration: ána bɧibb libsēnēt bass mā bɧibb liklēb ktīr.
arabic: أنا بْحِبّ الِبْسيْنات بسّ ما بْحِبّ الِكْلاب كْتير.

english: to get on, get in, take (a bus, taxi, etc.)
to get off, get out of
I usually go to work by bus.
I take the metro every day.

arabic: ساوِم عالسِّعِر، يْساوِم عالسِّعِرحرّج عالسِّعِر، يْحرِّج عالسِّعِر

english: The traffic is horrible right now!
Let’s not go downtown right now. It’s rush hour.
arabic: بلا ما نِنْزل عالبلد هلّق، وقِت عجْأة.

english: to have the right of way
cross walk, pedestrian crossing (UK: zebra crossing)
You can just drop me off on the corner.
to give a lift to, take
Can you give me a ride home?
He never uses his turn signal.
I put the car in reverse and started backing up.
to speed, go over the speed limit
The police pulled me over for speeding.
arabic: الشُرْطة وقّفِتْني على جنب بْسبب السِّرْعة.

english: to put on one’s seatbelt, wear one’s seat belt
There’s a dent in the side of the car.
Turn on your headlights when it starts to get dark.
to get in an accident, have an accident
He crashed (his car) into a tree.
The car was totaled in the accident.
abaya (traditional full-length outer garment, most commonly for women, but also for men)
to take __ out of one’s pocket
What size shoes do you wear?
I’m not sure about my size.
to wear, to get dressed, to put on
What are you going to wear today?
He took a shower, got dressed, and left for work.
just right (not too loose or tight)
This shirt is wrinkled. I need to iron it.
a diamond ring, gold bracelet, and silver necklace
transliteration: xātim almās, iswāra dáhab, u 3áʔid fúɖɖa
arabic: خاتِم ألْماس، إسْوارة دهب وعقِد فُضّة

english: I have some relatives that live in New York.
How many children do you have?
My brother and my friend’s brother came with me.
transliteration: xayyi w rfīʔ xáyyi íju má3i.

english: Do you have any brothers or sisters?
I have two older sisters and one younger brother.
transliteration: 3índi ixtēn ákbar mínni u wáɧdi áʂɣar.
arabic: عِنْدي إخْتيْن أكْبر مِنّي وواحْدِة أصْغر.

english: I’m the youngest in my family.
What do you feel like eating?
He took a bite of the hamburger and put it down.
transliteration: áxad líʔmi min ilhāmbirgir u táraka.

english: She took a sip of water and put the glass down.
transliteration: xádit šáfit māy u ɧáʈʈit lkibbēyi.

english: I'm so thirsty. Could I have some water?
Taste the soup. Does it need salt?
I don’t like how it tastes.
to expire, be past its expiration date
The milk is past its expiration date.
How does the soup taste? It’s a little salty.
Potato chips are really bad for you.
If I feel hungry, I just have a small snack.
Can I have a glass of water, please?
There’s a can of cola in the fridge.
How would you like your coffee?
Eat your ice cream before it melts.
Areesh cheese (similar to cottage cheese or Ricotta)
Halloumi cheese (semi-hard, unripened cheese made from goat milk)
Romy cheese (a sharp, pungent, hard cheese)
Dark chocolate is better for you than milk chocolate.
transliteration: ššōkōlā lɣāmʔa aɧsánlak min iššōkōlā b-ɧalīb.
arabic: الشّوكولا الغامْقة أحْسنْلك مِن الشّوْكوْلا بْحليب.

english: qatayef (sweet dumpling with nuts and cream)
I don’t feel like chicken. Let’s have beef.
arabic: ما عبالي دْجاج. تعا نْجيب لحْمِة.

english: This meat has a lot of fat on it.
Thank you for the meal! (said to host(ess) after having tried the food)
to talk with one’s mouth full
Don’t talk with your mouth full!
Excuse me for a moment. (when excusing oneself from the table)
Thank you for the meal. (said after finishing a meal in someone’s home)
I don’t feel well. I think I need to go see a doctor.
transliteration: ɧēsis ɧāli ta3bēn. bí3tiʔid lēzim šūf iddoktōr.
arabic: حاسِس حالي تعْبان. بِعْتِقِد لازِم شوف الدُّكْتوْر.

english: The doctor examined him and diagnosed him with the flu.
transliteration: ddoktōr fáɧaʂu u ʔāl má3u grīb.

english: I have a really bad headache.
My shoulder has been hurting for ages.
to be congested, have nasal congestion
to perform surgery on, operate on
to perform surgery on, operate on
to undergo surgery, have an operation
to undergo surgery, have an operation
How far along is she [in her pregnancy]?
I’m going to the dentist’s to get a check-up and a cleaning.
transliteration: rāyiɧ3ind doktōr lisnēn á3mil tšek-ap u náɖɖif snēni.
arabic: رايِح عِنْد دُكْتور الِسْنان أعْمِل شِك أب ونضِّف سْناني.

english: I need to practice speaking more.
You can’t understand anything he says.
I can speak a little Arabic.
I can get by in Arabic.
How do you pronounce this word?
Your Arabic pronunciation is quite good.
I need to work on my listening skills in Arabic.
arabic: لازِم اِشْتِغِل على تمارين السّماع بِالعربي.

english: to look up a word in the dictionary
I live in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon.

transliteration: kill síni u ínta b-xēr! - u ínta b-xēr!
arabic: كِلّ سِنِة وإنْتَ بْخيْر! - وإنْتَ بْخيْر.

english: Happy birthday and may you have many more!
transliteration: kill síni u ínta b-xēr u 3aʔbēl ilmīt síni u nšālla yin3ād 3alēk.
arabic: كِلّ سِنِة وإنْتَ بْخيْر وعقْبال المية سِنِة وإنْشالله يِنْعاد عليْك.
لح يْصير عُمْرو عِشْرين سِنِة الأُسْبوع الجّايِة.

transliteration: xlíʔit b-isínt alf u tisi3míyyi u tmēnīn.

english: How did you work that out in your head? I need a calculator!
transliteration: kīf ɧasábit háyda b-3áʔlak? ána báddi ēli ɧēsbi.
arabic: كيف حسبِت هَيْدا بْعقْلك؟ أنا بدّي آلِة حاسْبِة.

english: Add up the price of all the items to get the total.
transliteration: jmā3 ɧaʔʔ kill liɣrāɖ la-tá3rif ilmajmū3.
arabic: جْماع حقّ كِلّ الِغْراض لتعْرِف المجْموع.

english: Subtract the smaller amount from the larger to find the difference.
transliteration: ʈrāɧ rráʔam liʂɣīr min likbīr minšēn tá3rif ilfáriʔ.
arabic: طْراح الرّقِم الِصْغير مِن الِكْبير مِنْشان تعْرِف الفرِق.

english: Multiply the length and width to find the area of the rectangle.
transliteration: ɖrūb iʈʈūl b-il3áriɖ minšēn tíɧsub masēɧit ilmustaʈīl.
arabic: ضْروب الطّول بِالعرِض مِنْشان تِحْسُب مساحِة المُسْتطيل.

english: Divide the total by the number of people to find the average.
transliteration: ʔsum irráʔam 3ála 3adad innēs minšēn tá3rif lim3áddal.
arabic: قْسوم الرقم على عدْد النّاس مِنْشان تعْرِف المْعدّل.

english: Twenty divided by four equals five.
There are twenty books, and the twentieth book is mine.
transliteration: fī 3išrīn ktēb u liktēb il3išrīn la-ili.
arabic: في عِشْرين كْتاب والِكْتاب العِشْرين لإلي.

english: Let’s go for a walk in the park.

transliteration: ʈáyyar ʈayyārat wáraʔ, yʈáyyir ʈayyārat wáraʔ
arabic: طيّر طيّارة وَرق، يْطيِّر طيّارة وَرق

english: We hung out at the shopping mall yesterday evening.
I like to sit in a coffe shop and read the newspaper before I go to work.
transliteration: bɧibb ú3ʔud b-ilkāfē íʔra jjarīdi ʔábil mā rūɧ 3a-ššíɣil.
arabic: بْحِبّ أُقْعُد بِالكافيْه اِقْرا الجّريدِة قبِل ما روح عالشِّغِل.

english: What do you like to watch on TV?
I haven’t seen the second season of this show yet.
transliteration: ba3d mā šíft ilmáwsam ittēni min háyda lmusálsal.
arabic: بعْد ما شِفْت المَوْسم التّاني مِن هَيْدا المُسلْسل.

english: Have you ever been on TV?
There’s an interesting program on channel 3.
arabic: في بِرْنامِج حِلو على الإذاعة التّالْتِة.

english: I can’t hear what they’re saying. Could you turn the TV up a bit?
transliteration: miš sēmi3 šū 3am yíɧku, má3li t3álli ʂʂōt šwayy?
arabic: مِش سامِع شو عم يِحْكو، معْلي تْعلّي الصّوْت شْوَيّ؟

english: I’m trying to study. Could you turn the TV down a bit?
transliteration: 3am ɧāwil ídrus, má3li twáʈʈi ʂʂōt šwayy?
arabic: عم حاوِل إدْرُس، معْلي تْوَطّي الصّوْت شْوَيّ؟

english: to forward, skip to the next track
to rewind, go back to (the previous track)
Excuse me. Would you take a photo of us?
Let’s go to the cinema this weekend.
A new movie is coming out on Friday. Want to go?
transliteration: fī mūvī jdīd nēzil ijjúm3a, báddak nrūɧ?
arabic: في موفي جْديد نازِل الجِّمْعة، بِدك نْروح؟

english: They’re showing a classic movie this evening.
to sit close to the screen
I don’t like to sit too close to the screen.
What kind of movies do you like?
I love action movies, but I can’t stand romantic movies.
transliteration: ktīr bɧibb aflēm lʔakšin bass mā bɧibb aflēm rrōmāns ábadan.
arabic: كْتير بْحِبّ أفْلام الاكْشِن بسّ ما بْحِبّ أفْلام الرّوْمانْس أبداً.

english: No, thank you. I don’t smoke.
What is the illiteracy rate in Lebanon?
when I was in elementary school, ...
Her son is in first grade.
I teach Arabic at a language academy in Lebanon.
arabic: عمْ درِّس عربي بِمرْكز تعْليم اللُّغات بِلِبْنان.

english: in one’s second year of middle school
in one’s third year of high school
I have six classes a day.
Class starts at 8 o'clock and finishes at 9 o'clock.
transliteration: ʂʂaf bibálliš issē3a tmēni u bixálliʂ issē3a tís3a.
arabic: الصّفّ بيبلِّش السّاعة تْمانِة وبيخلِّص السّاعة تِسْعة.

english: to ask a question in class
We have a fifteen-minute break between classes.
arabic: عِنّا رِبِع ساعة فُرْصة بيْن الصّْفوف.

english: He needs to study for the test.
The students have to write an essay about a historical event.
transliteration: lēzim yíktub ittalimīz mawɖū3 3an ɧádas tārīxi.
arabic: لازِم يِكْتُب التلاِميذ موضوع عن حدث تاريِخي.

english: Do you teach at the university?
I intend to enroll in an Arabic class next month.
arabic: ناوي سجِّل بْصفّ عربي الشّهِر الجّاي.

english: to get into college, start university
I got into the faculty of medicine, but later I changed to law.
transliteration: fítit 3ála kullíyyit iʈʈúbb, ba3dēn ɣayyárit ɧʔūʔ.
arabic: فِتِت على كِلّية الطُبّ، بعْديْن غيّرِت حْقوق.

english: When did you graduate from university?

transliteration: txárrajit min ijjēm3a sinit alfēn u xámsi.
arabic: تْخرّجِت مِن الجّامْعة سِنِة الْفيْن وخمْسِة.

english: All the freshmen have to attend an orientation ceremony.
arabic: كِلّ تلاميِذ الِفْريشْمان معْزومين عالمُحاضرة التَّوْجيهية.

english: He got a certificate for completing the course.
What was your favorite subject in school?
transliteration: áyya áktar mēddi kinit tɧíbba b-ilmádrasi?
arabic: أيّا اكْتر مادِّة كِنِت تْحِبّا بِالمدْرسِة؟

english: I really enjoyed studying history, but I hated science class.
transliteration: kínit ktīr ɧibb ídrus tārīx bass kínt íkrahʂaff issāyins.
arabic: كِنِت كْتير حِبّ اِدْرُس تاريخ بسّ كِنْت اِكْره صفّ السّايِنْس.

english: to frown, knit one’s brow, scowl
to frown, knit one’s brow, scowl
sclera, the white of one’s eyes
I can’t see the clock from here.
transliteration: miš ʔadrān šūf issā3a min hūn.
arabic: مِش قدْران شوف السّاعة مِن هون.

english: Why are your eyes red? Have you been crying?
arabic: ليْه عْيونك حُمُر؟ كِنْت عم تِبْكي؟

english: I don’t have a very good sense of smell.
Can you taste the mint in this dessert?
He started choking on a piece of food.
She has long beautiful straight brown hair.
transliteration: šá3ra ʈawīl u ɧílu u nē3im u bínni.

english: She wears her hair in braids.
She usually wears her hair in a bun.
You can tell he wears a toupee.
He has a beard and mustache.
I have a huge pimple on my chin!
As a teenager, he had a lot of acne.
transliteration: kēn 3índuɧabb iššabēb lámma kēn b-3úmur ilmurāhaqa.
arabic: كان عِنْدو حبّ الشّباب لمّا كان بْعُمُر المُراهقة.

english: She has a lot of freckles.
You get wrinkles as you get older.
arabic: كِلّْما تِكْبر بيصير عِنْدك تجاعيد أكْتر.

english: He has a tattoo on his left arm.
They’re all wearing watches on their wrists.
He was very sweaty after playing soccer.
I need to go to the bathroom.
I need to go to the bathroom.

transliteration: ʈūli míyyi u xámsi u sab3īn sánti.

english: Don’t overeat so you don’t get fat.
transliteration: mā tēkul ktīr ɧátta mā tíʈxan.
arabic: ما تاكُل كْتير حتّى ما تِطْخن.

english: My God, those girls are so cute!
I can’t understand a word you said.
transliteration: mā fhímit šī min yálli ʔíltu.
arabic: ما فْهِمِت شي مِن يَلّي قِلْتو.

english: She carried the box to the kitchen.
to finish, come to an end
The ball is floating in the water.
arabic: الطّابِة عم تُطْفي ع سطِح الماي.

english: to get, take, receive, obtain; pick up, grab
He picked the book up from the table.
I intend to succeed at my job.
The Titanic sank over a hundred years ago.
transliteration: ttāytēnik ɣírʔit min áktar min mīt síni.
arabic: التّايْتانيك غِرْقِت مِن أكْتر مِن مية سِنِة.

english: He set down the book on the table.
It’s below zero. It’s below freezing.
How hot does it get where you’re from?
Where I’m from, it doesn’t usually get over 30 degrees in the summer.
transliteration: máʈraɧ ma b3īš, lɧarāra mā btúʈla3 fōʔ ittlētīn.
arabic: مطْرح ما بْعيش، الحرارة ما بْتِطْلع فوْق التّْلاتين.

english: It’s hotter than it was yesterday.
Does it snow where you’re from?
Where I’m from, it snows a lot in the winter.
There was a flash of lightning.
The thunder woke me up last night.
Do you think it’s going to rain?
It looks like (it’s going to) rain.
I work five days a week.

arabic: دوّر على شِغِل، يْدوِّر على شِغِل
قدّم على شِغِل، يْقدِّم على شِغِل

english: Have you found a job yet?
to finish work, get off work
I work eight hours a day.
transliteration: ána bištíɣil dawēm tmin sē3āt kill yōm.
arabic: أنا بِشْتِغِل دَوام تْمِن ساعات كِلّ يوْم.

english: to stay late at the office
to go on a business trip
I get paid on the first of the month.
I got a promotion this month.

transliteration: nʈárad min šíɣlu, yinʈúrid min šíɣlu

english: I hope to retire when I’m sixty.
I work five days a week.

arabic: دوّر على شُغُل، يْدوِّر على شُغُل
قدّم على شُغُل، يْقدِّم على شُغُل

english: Have you found a job yet?
to finish work, get off work
I work eight hours a day.
transliteration: ána baštíɣil dawām táman sā3āt fi -lyōm.
arabic: أنا بشْتِغِل دَوام تمن ساعات في اليوْم.

english: to stay late at the office
arabic: اِتْأخّر في المكْتب، يِتْأخّر في المكْتب

english: to go on a business trip
I get paid on the first of the month.
I got a promotion this month.
I hope to retire when I'm sixty.
